comment.author: 26543934@N06
comment._content:
Great job? 
By 1965 Ghana was virtually bankrupt. A governmant spending spree between 59 and 64 had £430m. GNP was stagnant between 60-66 and the real value of the minimum wage halved in that time. Nkrumah was surrounded by sychophants and praised daily in the press. He became increasingly remote from the realities of the crisis Ghana was facing. However, despite the economic failings, it was his meddling with the army - with his spies and trying to subvert it to his own ends - that led to his downfall.
